page.title: 05Forestry in Durris
page.content: There are several forests in our block which have been planted by the Forestry Commission.They consist mainly of Sitka Spruce with some Scots Pine and European Larch.There is a Forestry Office in the block and quite a lot of people are employed by the Commission in forestry work.Many of the forests were planted over forty years ago,and are the right age for cutting,so there is a lot of felling to be done just now.You can hear the sound of power saws every day and see the huge lorries carrying the cut trees away.Up in the forests there is a lot of machinery for lifting and dragging the trees out.So much wood has been taken out lately that the whole landscape round here has changed.The timber is used for making into pulp for paper,furniture and pallets,and some for firewood.
